definition: to waste all one's previous efforts (idiom)/all that has been achieved goes down the drain
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly
meritorious deed or service/achievement/result/service/accomplishment/work (physics)
to use up/to exhaust/to end/to finish/to the utmost/exhausted/finished/to the limit (of sth)/all/entirely
to the greatest extent/(when used before a noun of location) furthest or extreme/to be within the limits of/to give priority to
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: It must be found, or else all this work is meaningless.
sentences.chinese: 必须找到它，不然会前功尽弃。

sentences.english: Now if I cut it, all my previous work will be wasted.
sentences.chinese: 如果我现在把它剪断，就等于前功尽弃。

sentences.english: On the first Vanadiel day you attempt to feed the chocobo and he does not take.
sentences.chinese: 期间我要是喂过他会不会前功尽弃？

sentences.english: And if a single word were to come from your mouth, all your work would be lost.
sentences.chinese: 只要你嘴里漏出一个字，一切努力就前功尽弃啦。

definition: lit. to ruin the enterprise for the sake of one basketful/to fail through lack of a final effort/to spoil the ship for a ha'penny worth of tar (idiom)
the gains do not make up for the losses (idiom)
basket for carrying soil
to commit to the waters (idiom); to lose sth irrevocably
to fail within sight of success (idiom); last-minute failure/to fall at the last hurdle/snatching defeat from the jaws of victory
see 一著不慎，滿盤皆輸|一着不慎，满盘皆输[yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1]
mistake/error/mishap
to waste (one's energy etc)
to give up halfway (idiom); leave sth unfinished
consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
wasted effort
to overreach oneself/to try to be clever and end up with egg on one's face
successfully accomplished (project or goal)/to be highly successful
mistake/slip-up/fault/error (in data transmission)/accident/mishap
to ruin one's constitution
